78 Patarsco River CROSSING

tenance, operation and insurance estimated for the proposed bridge by
Coverdale and Colpitts, and hereinbefore tabulated in Table 22.

To the above total Mr. Singstad, in his estimate of the maintenance and
operation cost, has added an item of $25,000 for administration, which for
the purposes of this estimate, may be considered as fully covered under
““General and Administrative Expenses for Maintaining and Operating the
Bridges,” since it is reasonable to assume that this general and adminis-
trative expense would not be materially different whether all crossings are
bridges, or whether a tunnel may be included as one of the crossings.

Electrician. ......... ... 1 2,000
a0 FOTOINIAIL, ¢ «.o: 5 consn s s st 5 it i ol o6 e ek o s o 4808 s o o 0 1 1,750
MeChaniCs. .. ...ttt e 4 @ $1,750 7,000
Laborers. ... ... ... .. 9 @ $1,500 13,500
Captain of Police and Tolls................... ... ............ 1 3,000
Sergeants of Police and Tolls.................................. 2 @ $%$2,000 4,000
Toll Collectors. ...... ..o 12 @ $1,750 21,000
TS DRI .. 5 5 ms g mmh b B oA e s | 22@ 81,750 38,500
Total Wages, Maintenance and Operation Personnel............................ $105,000
Power for Ventilation and Lighting @ 1.7¢ per kwh............................... $34,000
Maintenance Materials... ... ... iue i $12,500
IS ANCE v 0 b 518 15 NS AL & e E s Enns e o A 1 B o sy e T e B $16,500
OO DI TEONCIOR csiasmin 5 5w 1ea & 5 00 00 i & 6 o B30 5 ) 5 0 5 B M 505 S 0% BB S 5 00 $7,000
Total Maintenance, Operation and Insurance..............................c.... $175.000



The estimate of $175,000 for maintenance and operation of the tunnel,
hereinbefore presented, does not cover the approach roadway maintenance
or painting reserve for the structural steel work of the elevated approach
required as a part of the tunnel approach construction, in case a tunnel is used
for the river crossing. To the above estimates there must be added, there-
fore, an amount estimated to be about $12,000. It is, therefore, estimated
that the complete maintenance and operation expenses for the tunnel and
approaches would amount to approximately $187,000 per annum, exclusive
of the general and administrative expenses referred to herein.

TRAFFIC REPORT

Coverdale and Colpitts, Consulting Engineers, New York City, under
date of September 3, 1938 have reported to the State Roads Commission
